com.company

Class PlayingSystem

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.company.PlayingSystem

  • public class PlayingSystem
extends java.lang.Object
    This class is the most important class in this game . It controls the whole game , prints the board (map) , updates it and flip the surrounded tokens , adds a new toke with checking all the conditions , find the available places for a new token to be added , checks if the game has finished or not and has the control of turns along the game .

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      PlayingSystem(int color1Value, int color2Value)
      Makes a new game with the given color value for each player .

    • Constructor Detail

      • PlayingSystem

        public PlayingSystem(int color1Value,
                     int color2Value)
        Makes a new game with the given color value for each player . Makes a new list of all tokens for the game and adds the players .
        Parameters:
        color1Value - color value number for first player
        color2Value - color value number for second player

    • Method Detail

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        Prints the board (map) of our game . Checks each token x and y with the for loops parameters , if the are equal it means there is a token in that place .

      • printData

        public void printData()
        Prints all tokens shape which shows their color , and also x and y for each of them .

      • playTurn

        public int playTurn()
        Has control over the turns of players in the game . If the last turn is 1 then it changes to 2 and also does the opposite .
        Returns:
        player turn to be played

      • findAvailablePlaces

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> findAvailablePlaces(int turn)
        This method finds the available and legal places for a token to be put . Due to the rules of the game for a player , the token should be put in a place that surrounds the other players tokens .
        Parameters:
        turn - player turn
        Returns:
        an array list which is made of array lists which in each of them the first index is the x and the second is the y for available places for new token to be put .

      • getTokenColorValue

        public int getTokenColorValue(int x,
                              int y)
        Gets the color value (unicode) of the token in the specified place with given x and y.
        Parameters:
        x - x of the token
        y - y of the token
        Returns:
        unicode ( color value ) number

      • checkTokenExistence

        public boolean checkTokenExistence(int x,
                                   int y)
        Checks if a token exist in the specified place with given x and y .
        Parameters:
        x - x of the place
        y - y of the place
        Returns:
        if a token is in there , true and if not ,false .

      • addNewToken

        public void addNewToken(int colorValue,
                        int y,
                        char c,
                        int turn,
                        java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> availablePlaces)
        Puts a new token to our board which checking all of the conditions . If the token is not repeated , and the place is in legal places found in findAvailablePlaces method and if the x and y are in the limitations of the map and not beyond them.
        Parameters:
        colorValue - color value number of the new token
        y - y value of the token
        c - character chosen for x
        turn - player turn
        availablePlaces - available and legal places which the token can be put in

      • updateBoard

        public void updateBoard(int turn,
                        int i,
                        int j,
                        int x,
                        int y)
        This is a method for updating our board ( map ) , means when we put a new token we give the x and y of it to this method , and it checks if the new token surrounds the opposite color tokens with tokens of himself , player can flip the opposite colors surrounded in between . i and j are the parameters which specify the line moving in , this method should be checked for i=1 and j=0 which is the straight line , i=0 and j=1 which is perpendicular line , i=1 and j=1 for diagonal line which starts from left down and ends in right up and at last i=-1 and j=1 which is for diagonal line which starts from right down and ends in left up .
        Parameters:
        turn - player turn
        i - parameter for specifying the line we are checking the tokens
        j - parameter for specifying the line we are checking the tokens
        x - x of new token which was put
        y - y of new token which was put

      • flip

        public void flip(int x,
                 int y)
        Flips the token and changes it color .
        Parameters:
        x - x of the token
        y - y of the token

      • checkEndGame

        public boolean checkEndGame()
        Checks if the game has ended or not , by checking if the map is not ful and if there is still available places for new token to be put in .
        Returns:
        true , if the game hasn't finished and false , if the game has finished .

      • setTurn

        public void setTurn(int turn)
        Sets the turn parameter .
        Parameters:
        turn - turn to be set

        Returns:
        random x generated

      • generateRandomY

        public int generateRandomY()
        When playing with the computer , for computer's turn it generates a random y .
        Returns:
        random y generated

      • checkRandomPlace

        public boolean checkRandomPlace(int x,
                                int y,
                                java.util.ArrayList<java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer>> availablePlaces)
        Checks if the given place is in available places or not .
        Parameters:
        x - x of the given place
        y - y of the given place
        availablePlaces - available places
        Returns:
        if it exits in the available places , it returns true and if not , it returns false.
